byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Düsseldorf, Germany.

abstract: Information recovered from flight data recorder of Germanwings airliner that crashed into the French Alps in March indicates co-pilot Andreas Lubitz deliberately accelerated, guiding plane toward ground and twice shutting off speed warning signal during descent.
lead_paragraph: Data showed that Andreas Lubitz used the autopilot to direct the plane to descend to 100 feet, then repeatedly increased the speed.

headline.main: Germanwings Co-Pilot Accelerated During Descent, Data From 2nd Recorder Shows
headline.print_headline: New Data Show Co-Pilot Accelerated Plane Toward Demise

snippet: Data showed that Andreas Lubitz used the autopilot to direct the plane to descend to 100 feet, then repeatedly increased the speed.
